ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Interface_requirement_occurrence is a type of . An Interface_requirement_occurrence may specify either the assembly interface to the next higher assembly or a physical layer of a protocol.

the reference_protocol specifies the role of the for the Interface_requirement_occurrence. This specifies the physical layer of a protocol that is to be supported by the interface. The value of this attribute is optional and need not be specified.

the interface_to_next_higher_assembly specifies the role of the for the Interface_requirement_occurrence. This specifies the component in the next assembly that is the interface. The value of this attribute is optional and need not be specified.

A Protocol_physical_layer_definition is a type of . A Protocol_physical_layer_definition is a description of the information needed to specify requirements for the lowest level interface for a communication or other engineering operational protocol. The protocol specification is referenced by the documentation attribute inherited from the Ee_product_definition Application Object. A Protocol_physical_layer_definition includes references to minimum information for connectors, host transmit and receive functional definitions, and host transmit and receive functional characteristics. The functional definitions should be used to identify signal names if needed, as it is common for protocols to not define connectors. If the protocol defines a connector and signal names for that connector, then the functional definition terminals are mapped to the host connector terminals using one or more . A media_connector may be a connector on an antenna. The host_connector and media_connector form a mated pair when assembled via their respective . If the protocol does not define a connector or if non-standard connector implementation is chosen, members of may be populated to specify the product specific mapping for the protocol. The Protocol_physical_layer_definition is provided to enable verification of product models against physical and functional requirements imposed by protocol definitions. The Protocol_physical_layer_definition is referenced by to establish a requirement. The functional requirements are most often functional in nature but are not required to be by this part of ISO 10303. A physical layer consisting of RS 232 compliant elements would be represented by a host functional unit, a media functional unit, a host connector, a media connector, and members of Functional_usage_view_to_part_terminal_assignment to accomplish the functional to physical mapping. the media_connector specifies one role of the for the Protocol_physical_layer_definition. The media_connector is optional and need not be supplied.
the host_connector specifies one role of the for the Protocol_physical_layer_definition. The host_connector is optional and need not be supplied.

A Minimally_defined_connector is a type of whose functionality is defined by a communications protocol. The protocol specifies signal names for each connector terminal, and may specify impedance and other electrical characteristics. A Minimally_defined_connector does not specify sufficient information to use the connector in a design, as only the interface terminals are identified. There shall be at least one in the members of that reference the Minimally_defined_connector. One use for a Minimally_defined_connector is as a reference for a communications protocol.
